author: Ryan Daws
description:
Java, which first blinked into existence in 1995, is 30 years old this week and continues to be a stalwart in modern programming. Brian Fox, Co-founder and CTO of Sonatype, puts it perfectly. Java, he says, kicked off with a “bold promise of portability and simplicity.” That legendary “write once, run anywhere” wasn’t just a... Read more »

The post Java at 30: Still brewing success or evaporating? appeared first on Developer Tech News.
title: Java at 30: Still brewing success or evaporating?

author: Ryan Daws
description:
At KotlinConf 2025, JetBrains showcased Kotlin advancements including language enhancements, the maturation of the K2 compiler, tooling like Amper, strides in KMP, and a push into AI. Eyes are on Kotlin 2.2, which is set to bring some rather useful features to the table. Developers can start getting ready for guard conditions in when-with-subject, multi-dollar... Read more »

The post JetBrains reveals Kotlin 2.2, Amper, AI tools at KotlinConf 2025 appeared first on Developer Tech News.
title: JetBrains reveals Kotlin 2.2, Amper, AI tools at KotlinConf 2025
